feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Fri, 18 Aug 2023 20:01:10
entry.summary:
Tech:
- A driverless car in San Francisco got stuck in wet concrete after mistaking it for a regular road.
- Google DeepMind is testing an AI that can give life advice to users.
- Acronym and Asus have collaborated on a new computer.
- Google reminds users to clean their Pixel Buds regularly.

Business:
- VinFast's shares plummeted after its market debut.
- Elon Musk believes Warren Buffett missed out on investing in Tesla.
- Uber and Lyft may face challenges in Minneapolis.
- A real-estate listing in Michigan went viral for its $1 price tag.

AI:
- Researchers from MIT and Harvard propose a hypothesis on building a transformer using biological elements in the brain.
- Prompt Engineering Technique aims to bring certainty and uncertainty of generative AI to the forefront.
- The AI hype cycle experiences setbacks as some of this year's biggest winners face challenges.

Other:
- Americans are depleting their excess savings and could run out of funds this quarter, according to a Fed study.
- Free live stream available for the Women's World Cup Final between England and Spain.
- A Russian-backed general admits his troops cannot win against Ukraine.
- A rare Ferrari 250 GTO could be auctioned for $60 million.
- The vulnerability of healthcare supply chains is highlighted by a chemo drug storage incident.
- Families of dead Russian soldiers are being charged $1,500 to retrieve their bodies.
- China's slashing of US bond holdings contributes to a bond rout.
- Former teachers share their reasons for leaving the profession due to unpaid work.

Insights:
- The AI industry continues to advance with applications in various fields.
- Economic challenges and market fluctuations impact businesses and investments.
- Geopolitical tensions and conflicts affect international relations and human rights.
- The real estate market can experience unusual and viral listings.
- Personal experiences and burnout can lead individuals to make career changes.
